newsitem.title: NORWAY: Bona orders three ships from Samsung.
newsitem.headline: Bona orders three ships from Samsung.

text.p: Norway's Bona Shipholding ASA said on Friday it had signed newbuilding contracts with Samsung Heavy Industries of South Korea for three Aframax tankers at a total delivered cost of about $130 million.
In a statement to the Oslo Bourse, Bona said the vessels were scheduled for delivery in 1999 and designed to fit the requirements of Bona's customers.

"The building contract can be extended to provide additional vessels and will be the core of the company's fleet renewal programme. The vessels are modern 113,000 dwt double-hull tankers with a total carrying capacity of 800,000 barrels of crude oil in 128,500 m3 of cargo space," the statement said.
